feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 11:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Near Bankfull Water Levels On The Yukon River From Eagle To Circle This Weekend And Early Next Week... The Yukon River at Dawson, YT is very high and expected to rise through the weekend. Downstream at Eagle, near bankfull conditions are expected by Sunday night. This water will continue downstream early next week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:14AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow In The Brooks Range Through Tonight... Up to 3 inches of snow is expected in the Central and Eastern Brooks Range through tonight. Snow will melt soon after falling in most areas below 2000 feet, but snow may accumulate in areas above 2000 ft. This includes the Dalton Highway near Atigun Pass, and the village of Anaktuvuk Pass. Snow is expected to taper off

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:59AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Hot and Humid Conditions Today... The combination of increased temperatures and continued humid weather will result in afternoon heat index values topping out in the 90s to locally around 100 degrees. Given this is the first real run up of heat this season, some folks could experience heat illness since we have not yet had a chance to become acclimated

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 10 at 3:42AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warmest temperatures of the season bring high river flows... The warmest temperatures of the season will enhance snowmelt in the mountains, resulting in high and increasing flows on area waterways. Snow monitoring sites in the high country have shown increasing snow melt, and warming snowpack temperatures, increasing the potential for a rapid snowmelt.
